intro: Brachystephanus jaundensis subsp. jaundensis, commonly known as the yellow stephanus, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shaded areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. It is native to parts of southern Africa and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
